thing-type.label: ZW175 Smart Switch 7
thing-type.description: Smart Switch 7<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtAeotec Smart Switch 7 (SS7) has been crafted to power connected lighting using SmartStart, S2 framework, and Z-Wave Plus. It is powered by Aeotec’s S2 technology. </p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtSmart Switch 7 is intended for indoor use in dry locations only. Do not use in damp, moist, and/or wet locations.</li&gt <li&gtMax-amperage: 15 amps for ZW175-A</li&gt <li&gtMay-amperage: 10 amps for ZW175-C</li&gt </ul&gt<br /&gt<h2&gtInclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gtGetting your Smart Switch up and running is as simple as plugging it into a wall socket and adding it to your Z-Wave network.</p&gt <ol&gt<li&gtSet your Z-Wave Controller into its 'Add Device' mode in order to add the product into your Z-Wave system. Refer to the Controller's manual if you are unsure of how to perform this step.</li&gt <li&gtPower your Smart Switch 7 to any outlet; its LED will be breathing a blue light if it is ready to be paired.</li&gt <li&gtClick Action Button 2 times slowly to set your Smart Switch 7 into pair mode.</li&gt <li&gtIf your Z-Wave Controller supports S2 encryption, enter the first 5 digits of DSK into your Controller's interface if it is requested. The DSK is printed on its Smart Switch 7.<br /&gta) If pairing succeeds, it will become a bright blue light for 2 seconds. Smart Switch 7 is now a part of your Z-Wave home control system. You can configure it and its automation via your Z-Wave system; please refer to your software's user guide for precise instructions.<br /&gtb) If pairing fails, it will light a solid bright red light for 2 seconds and then return to a breathing blue light; repeat steps 1 to 4 if this happens.</li&gt </ol&gt<br /&gt<h2&gtExclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gtYour Smart Switch can be removed from your Z-Wave network at any time. You’ll need to use your Z-Wave network’s main controller to do this and the following instructions will tell you how to do this using Aeotec by Aeon Labs’ Z-Stick or Minimote controller.<br /&gt<br /&gtIf you are using other products as your main Z-Wave controller, please refer to the part of their respective manuals that tells you how to remove devices from your network.</p&gt <p&gtIf you're using an existing gateway:</p&gt <ol&gt<li&gtSet your Z-Wave Controller into its 'Remove Device' / 'Unpair Device' mode in order to remove the product from your Z-Wave system. Refer to the Controller's manual if you are unsure of how to perform this step.</li&gt <li&gtMake sure the product is powered. If not, plug it into a wall socket and power it on.</li&gt <li&gtClick Action Button 2 times quickly; it will bright violet light up to 2s.<br /&gta. If Removing fails, it will bright red light for 2 seconds and then turn back to Load Indicator Mode; repeat steps 1 to 3. Contact us for further support if needed.<br /&gtb. If Removing succeeds, it will become breathing blue light. Smart Switch 7 is removed from the Z-Wave network successfully and is ready to be paired again.</li&gt </ol&gt

parameter.name: config_4_2
parameter.label: 4: Overload threshold
parameter.description: Set Watt (W) Threshold for Overpower.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtIf power exceeds the value set in this parameter for over 1 minute, Smart Switch 7 will report and overload report and turn off Smart Switch 7.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_8_1
parameter.label: 8: Switch reaction to alarm
parameter.description: What do to when an alarm is recieved<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSet the response of the switch in response to an operation performed when an alarm is received.</p&gt</p&gt

options.option: Turn the switch on and off

parameter.name: config_9_2
parameter.label: 9: Alarm reaction when received
parameter.description: Configure what alarms Smart Switch 7 will react to from other Z-Wave devices.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<table&gt<tr&gt<td&gt<strong&gtValue</strong&gt</td&gt <td&gt<strong&gtDescription</strong&gt</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt0</td&gt <td&gtThe alarm will be triggered by open state, and be disabled by closed state.</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt1</td&gt <td&gtThe alarm will be triggered by closed state, and be disabled by open state.</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt256</td&gt <td&gtSmoke alarm.</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt512</td&gt <td&gtCO Alarm</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt1024</td&gt <td&gtCO2 Alarm</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt2048</td&gt <td&gtHeat Alarm</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt4096</td&gt <td&gtWater Alarm</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt8192</td&gt <td&gtAccess Control</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt16384</td&gt <td&gtHome Security</td&gt </tr&gt</table&gt<p&gtValue 0 and 1 cannot be used at the same time, choose one as a part of your calculation.</p&gt <p&gtUse the sum of values to determine what alarms trigger your Smart Switch 7.</p&gt <p&gtFor example:</p&gt <p&gtValue = 0 + 256 + 512 + 1024 = 1792<br /&gt0 = sets the control scheme to turn on Smart Switch 7 when open alarm state happens</p&gt <p&gt256 = allows Smoke Alarm signals to control SS7</p&gt <p&gt512 = allows CO Alarm signals to control SS7</p&gt <p&gt1024 = allows CO2 Alarm signals to control SS7</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_10_1
parameter.label: 10: Release/Disable alarm
parameter.description: Sets how you are able to disable Smart Switch 7s alarm state<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<table&gt<tr&gt<td&gt<strong&gtValue</strong&gt</td&gt <td&gt<strong&gtDescription</strong&gt</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt0</td&gt <td&gtTap 3 times to disable the alarm state.</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt1</td&gt <td&gtNotification idle events.</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt10 - 255</td&gt <td&gtSets time in minutes on how long the alarm state should be held.</td&gt </tr&gt</table&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_18_2
parameter.label: 18: Flash frequency
parameter.description: Configures the LED flash frequency and amount of time<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<table&gt<tr&gt<td&gt<strong&gtByte Value</strong&gt</td&gt <td&gt<strong&gtDescription</strong&gt</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt(MSB Value 1)<br /&gt1 - 9</td&gt <td&gtSets the flash frequency in seconds. (Default = 0x0002 or 2)</td&gt </tr&gt</table&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_19_2_wo
parameter.label: 19: Start/Stop LED flash
parameter.description: Sets the timeframe of flashing in seconds

parameter.name: config_20_1
parameter.label: 20: Power restored state
parameter.description: Switches state after an power outage<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSets which state Smart Switch 7 switches to when power is lost then restored (power outage)</p&gt <table&gt<tr&gt<td&gt <p&gt<strong&gtValue</strong&gt</p&gt </td&gt <td&gt<strong&gtDescription</strong&gt</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt0</td&gt <td&gtLast known state. (restore state before power loss)</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt1</td&gt <td&gtPower restored to ON.</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt2</td&gt <td&gt <p&gtPower restored to OFF.</p&gt </td&gt </tr&gt</table&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_80_1
parameter.label: 80: Status Update
parameter.description: Determine which reports are sent to your gateway<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtKeeps the status of Smart Switch 7 in sync with your Z-Wave gateway. Determine which reports are sent to your gateway upon a state change (ie. If switch turns ON, then the switch will forward state update to Z-Wave gateway).</p&gt <p&gtSize = 1 Byte</p&gt <p&gtDefault Setting = 2</p&gt <table&gt<tr&gt<td&gt<strong&gtValue</strong&gt</td&gt <td&gt<strong&gtDescription</strong&gt</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt0</td&gt <td&gtNo report sent.</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt1</td&gt <td&gtReport Basic Report.</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt2</td&gt <td&gtReport Binary Switch.</td&gt </tr&gt</table&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_81_1
parameter.label: 81: LED indicator mode
parameter.description: Allows you to configure how the LED indicator works<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<table&gt<tr&gt<td&gtValue</td&gt <td&gtDescription</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt0</td&gt <td&gtLED Disabled.</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt1</td&gt <td&gtNight Light Mode. <ul&gt<li&gtUse Parameter 82 to configure Night Light timing.</li&gt <li&gtBrightness can be controlled via Multilevel Switch CC.</li&gt <li&gtColour can be controlled via Color Switch CC.</li&gt </ul&gt</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt2</td&gt <td&gtOn/Off Mode. <ul&gt<li&gtDefault use <ul&gt<li&gtON = 50% white light</li&gt <li&gtOFF = 10% green light</li&gt </ul&gt</li&gt <li&gtBrightness can be controlled via Multilevel Switch CC.</li&gt <li&gtColour can be controlled via Color Switch CC.</li&gt </ul&gt</td&gt </tr&gt</table&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_82_4
parameter.label: 82: Night Light Mode
parameter.description: Enable or disable Night Light Mode during specific times<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<table&gt<tr&gt<td&gtValue 1</td&gt <td&gtON Hour (0 - 23)</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gtValue 2</td&gt <td&gtON Minute (0 - 59)</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gtValue 3</td&gt <td&gtOFF Hour (0 - 23)</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gtValue 4</td&gt <td&gtOFF Minute (0 - 59)</td&gt </tr&gt</table&gt<p&gtByte value = 0x<strong&gt(Value 1)(Value 2)(Value 3)(Value 4)</strong&gt</p&gt <p&gtSuggestion - use a hexadecimal to decimal converter that can be easily found on google.</p&gt <p&gtFor example:</p&gt <p&gtIf you want to set Night Light Mode to be enabled at 19:00 at night and disable at 07:30 in the morning, you just need to configure:</p&gt <p&gtValue1=0x13, Value2=0x00, Value3=0x07, Value4=0x1E.</p&gt <p&gtInput 0x1300071E into a hexadecimal calculator, the output decimal value will be 318768926</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_91_2
parameter.label: 91: Watt threshold
parameter.description: When to send a watt report<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtIf Watt passes the threshold setting by + or -, a Watt report will be sent to update its value.</p&gt <table&gt<tr&gt<td&gt<strong&gtValue</strong&gt</td&gt <td&gt<strong&gtDescription</strong&gt</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt0</td&gt <td&gtDisable Watt threshold.</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt1 - 2300</td&gt <td&gtWatt threshold setting.</td&gt </tr&gt</table&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_92_2
parameter.label: 92: kWh threshold
parameter.description: When to send a kWh report<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtIf kWh passes the threshold setting by + or -, a kWh report will be sent to update its value.</p&gt <table&gt<tr&gt<td&gt<strong&gtValue</strong&gt</td&gt <td&gt<strong&gtDescription</strong&gt</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt0</td&gt <td&gtDisable kWh threshold.</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt1 - 10000</td&gt <td&gtkWh threshold setting.</td&gt </tr&gt</table&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_93_1
parameter.label: 93: Current threshold
parameter.description: When to send a current report<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtIf current passes the threshold setting by + or -, a current report will be sent to update its value.</p&gt <table&gt<tr&gt<td&gt<strong&gtValue</strong&gt</td&gt <td&gt<strong&gtDescription</strong&gt</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt0</td&gt <td&gtDisable Current threshold.</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt1 - 100</td&gt <td&gtCurrent threshold setting by scale of 0.1A</td&gt </tr&gt</table&gt<p&gtIf value 10 is set, this is the equivalent of setting threshold to 1.0A.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_101_4
parameter.label: 101: Timed report enable/disable
parameter.description: Configure timed report<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSets what sensors should be reported at a timed interval. This can be used at the same time as threshold reporting to allow both thresholds and timed reports to be used.</p&gt <table&gt<tr&gt<td&gt<strong&gtValue</strong&gt</td&gt <td&gt<strong&gtDescription</strong&gt</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt1</td&gt <td&gtkWh (Accumulated Power)</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt2</td&gt <td&gtWatt (Power used at the time of the report)</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt4</td&gt <td&gtCurrent</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt8</td&gt <td&gtVoltage</td&gt </tr&gt</table&gt<p&gtThe values in the table above should be added together. </p&gt <p&gtFor example:</p&gt <p&gtIf you want kWh and Watt only, you would add 1 + 2 = 3.<br /&gt<br /&gtIf you want all values (current, voltage, watt, kWh) reported at an interval, you would add 1 + 2 + 4 + 8 = 15.</p&gt <p&gtIf 0 is set to this parameter setting, this would completely disable timed reports. (Parameter 111 does not need to be set).</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_111_4
parameter.label: 111: Timed report interval
parameter.description: Reports the sensors set on Parameter 101<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtReports the sensors set on Parameter 101.</p&gt <p&gtSize = 4 Byte</p&gt <p&gtDefault Setting = 600</p&gt <table&gt<tr&gt<td&gt<strong&gtValue</strong&gt</td&gt <td&gt<strong&gtDescription</strong&gt</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt30 - 2592000</td&gt <td&gtInterval set in seconds.</td&gt </tr&gt</table&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_255_4
parameter.label: 255: Factory reset
parameter.description: Factory reset the smart switch 7<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis value can only be configured to reset default values of Smart Switch 7 parameter settings. This can also be used to factory reset and remove it from your Z-Wave network.</p&gt <table&gt<tr&gt<td&gt<strong&gtValue</strong&gt</td&gt <td&gt<strong&gtDescription</strong&gt</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt0</td&gt <td&gtDo nothing.</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gtAny value within 4 bytes.</td&gt <td&gtReset Parameter Settings to default settings.</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt0x55555555 or 1431655765</td&gt <td&gtCompletely factory reset and remove from network.</td&gt </tr&gt</table&gt</p&gt
